result.execSummary:
This case has not been concluded. Unless a judgment of conviction is entered, the defendant is presumed innocent of all charges.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

records.addlTxt: Atty Hart received and waives reading of Information.  Atty Hart enters not guilty pleas.  DE advised of charges and penalties.  Court enters not guilty plea(s).  Atty Hart advises there is a potential global resolution with his older case with this case be dismissed but read in.  State believes the older case will resolve by global resolution with dismissal of this case.  Court sets this matter as a status to track with 20CF136.

9:29 AM Defendant Logan N. Owen in court.  Attorney Rick C Spoentgen in court for State of Wisconsin.  Attorney Taylor M Hart in court for Logan N. Owen.  Court goes through waiver of prelim form with DE.  Court finds waiver to be free, knowing and voluntary.  Court finds probable cause, bind over for Br 2.
Status conference scheduled for December 19, 2022 at 11:00 am.
Status conference on December 19, 2022 at 11:00 am.

records.descr: Pet for appointment counsel,affidavit of indigency

records.addlTxt:
Pre-trial conference on May 13, 2022 at 09:30 am.
Return date on June 6, 2022 at 01:00 pm.

01:39 PM Defendant Logan N. Owen in court.  Natalia J Gess appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Court states case and appearances.  Court questions DE on his petition for court-appointed counsel.  DE currently works at Plateco.  DE currently has Atty Adam Raabe in another matter.  Court notes he was PD appointed.  Court finds DE conditionally indigent and appoints Atty Taylor Hart (608) 355-2000 - 620 8th Ave, Baraboo.  To reimburse COC's office $50/month beginning on or before 5/1/2022 and then by the first of each month thereafter.  Wage assignment to be completed.  Pre-trial conference scheduled for May 13, 2022 at 09:30 am.  Return date scheduled for June 6, 2022 at 01:00 pm.
Indigency hearing on March 10, 2022 at 11:45 am.

Pre-trial conference on March 4, 2022 at 09:00 am.
Return date on April 4, 2022 at 01:00 pm.

02:45 PM Defendant Logan N. Owen in court with attorney Annie E Getsinger.  Defendant Logan N. Owen in custody.  C. Remington McConnell appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Logan N. Owen appeared by video means with Attorney.  Defendant received and waives reading of complaint.  Court advises DE of charges/max penalties.  DE has Atty Lawton as court-appointed counsel in another matter and will likely have him appointed in this case also.  Advised of rights to an attorney.  Court finds probable cause based on complaint.  State requests $3,000 cash bond.  Atty Getsinger responds, requests lesser cash or signature bond.  Time limits waived for preliminary hearing.  $500.00 cash bond set.  Special bond conditions as follows:  none.  Pre-trial conference scheduled for March 4, 2022 at 09:00 am.  Return date scheduled for April 4, 2022 at 01:00 pm.
